function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Different coping methods may have varying effects in different types of buildings","Impact":"Ineffective coping methods in certain buildings may lead to increased risk of disease spread","Mitigation":"Conduct thorough research to identify the most effective coping methods for different types of buildings","Technologies":"Data analysis tools such as SPSS software for statistical analysis","People":"Researchers, building owners, and occupants","Owner":"Research institutions, building owners, public health authorities"},{"Description":"Observed covariance matrices are not equal between different construction groups","Impact":"Inequality of coping methods between different types of buildings may lead to ineffective disease control measures","Mitigation":"Conduct further analysis to understand the reasons for the inequality and adjust coping methods accordingly","Technologies":"Statistical analysis tools for covariance matrix analysis","People":"Statisticians, researchers, building owners","Owner":"Research institutions, building owners, public health authorities"},{"Description":"Significance and non-significance of multivariate tests can influence the interpretation of the study results","Impact":"Incorrect interpretation may lead to ineffective implementation of disease control measures in different types of buildings","Mitigation":"Ensure thorough understanding of the significance levels and consult with statistical experts for accurate interpretation","Technologies":"Statistical analysis tools for multivariate tests","People":"Researchers, statisticians, building owners","Owner":"Research institutions, building owners, public health authorities"}]}
